image.altText: A huge cylindrical structure with US-style stars and stripes painted on one end is seen at an ourdoor facility, with people.

items.synopsis: A Republican senator renews calls for the US to step up its production of nuclear-powered submarines before selling them to Australia, arguing America is as "unprepared" as it was ahead of the Pearl Harbor attack.

title.children: Two years after AUKUS pact, American politicians are divided on delivery of subs to Australia

image.altText: Hugh Jackman, right., and Deborra-Lee Furness Jackman attend a movie premiere.

items.synopsis: The couple release a statement confirming their split after 27 years of marriage, saying they have decided to "pursue individual growth".

title.children: 'Our journey now is shifting': Hugh Jackman and Deborra-Lee Furness announce separation

image.altText: A man in a yellow shirt and dirty face on a computer with other men on computers around him.

items.synopsis: China is working with neighbouring countries to crack down on the scam operations that are plaguing the region — including Australia.

title.children: Will China's scam crackdown have an effect in Australia?

image.altText: A map of the world with Australia at the fore and different coloured bands showing airmasses

items.synopsis: It's already feeling like summer. Temperatures in central and south-eastern Australia have climbed to 10 degrees Celsius above average and more hot weather is on the way.

title.children: Temperatures to challenge September records in ominous sign for spring

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wearing a black hoodie with the "yes" logo on the front.

items.synopsis: There are another four weeks until Australians will officially cast their votes in the first referendum in more than two decades. For the Yes campaign, there is a path to success, albeit a narrow one, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: Labor's grim week highlights the enormity of the task ahead for the Yes campaign

image.altText: An Australia batter looks frustrated after being dismissed in a men's ODI against South Africa.

items.synopsis: Travis Head suffers a fractured hand in a potential World Cup calamity for Australia amid a horror 164-run one-day hammering by South Africa in Centurion.

title.children: Head breaks hand in Australia's horror ODI loss to South Africa

image.altText: Man in suit points to chalkboard.

items.synopsis: When Robert Goddard thought he'd figured out how to get humans into space in 1920, the press called his ideas "absurd". Now, his ideas about rocket propulsion will help us create a petrol station on the Moon.

title.children: Robert Goddard's ideas were mocked a century ago. Now, his ideas will help build a petrol station on the Moon

image.altText: Queen Silvia dressed in a white gown and King Carl XVI Gustaf wearing a dark suit walk together in front of a guard.

items.synopsis: As some global royals come under the microscope for their role in modern society, it seems Sweden's king is more popular than ever, despite a scandal-plagued reign.

title.children: Sex parties, mafia mates … and more popular than ever: Sweden's king marks 50 years on the throne

image.altText: The Aussie dollar is a painful dollar for Nai and her children.

items.synopsis: A near-record number of Pacific Islanders are in Australia working on farms and abattoirs. The workforce has kept Australia's agricultural economy afloat and transformed the lives of thousands — but it comes at a cost.

title.children: The Aussie dollar is a painful dollar — Nai and her children feel it everyday

image.altText: Indigenous woman wearing an orange top with her hand to her chest. A large bottle of water is behind her.

items.synopsis: First Nations health professionals and those living with chronic health issues say they are "disappointed" and "deeply saddened" following Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's claims First Nations Australians are not living with ongoing negative impacts of colonisation.

title.children: First Nations health professionals 'deeply saddened' following senator's colonisation claims

image.altText: Two women take a selfie in front of a statue of a woman with snakes for hair

items.synopsis: Many mythical female monsters were created to scare women and children into submission. Today they could have a very different meaning.

title.children: Medusa was a terrifying monster. She might also be a feminist icon

image.altText: A small demon-like creature, the Knight, stands in a flowing blue cloak with a nail-like sword

items.synopsis: One of the most popular game development tools in the world announced new fees for using its service. It has left Australian game developers angry and perplexed — and could have ramifications for players, too.

title.children: Your next favourite video game could be delayed due to a new 'financial burden' on developers

image.altText: Mural done in Brunswick by the Feminista Melbourne Collective of Mahsa Jina Amini who was killed in September 2022.

items.synopsis: As Iran's authoritarian regime has increased its brutality, its citizens have become more defiant — in Tehran's streets and in cyberspace. Iranians in the diaspora say the regime's days are numbered.

title.children: One year on from Mahsa Amini's death, what has changed for Iranian women?

image.altText: A man with cap and white beard at a racing stables leans on a fence.

items.synopsis: It has been revealed a licence suspension handed to a top greyhound trainer was related to an allegation he had used an animal part as a lure for his dogs, as Tasmania's racing integrity watchdog clears him of concerns raised by animal welfare campaigners.

title.children: Top greyhound trainer faces ban over 'lure' allegation, as animal welfare concerns dismissed by watchdog

image.altText: Shoe and inserts.

items.synopsis: Police are seeking help to identify skeletal remains found on a farm property in the coastal Tasmanian suburb of Clifton Beach, along with shoes, keys and possible ID cards.

title.children: Mystery as human skeleton with black dress shoes found on farmland near Hobart

image.altText: A young blonde woman looks into the camera, it is a tight shot of her face.

items.synopsis: Ricardo Barbaro is found guilty of the murder of Tasmanian mother-of-one Ellie Price, who was found stabbed to death in her South Melbourne unit in 2020.

title.children: Man guilty of Tasmanian girlfriend's murder

image.altText: a map of Australia with patches of different shades of red in the ocean

items.synopsis: A marine heatwave will likely hit Tasmania just as seafood operators are harvesting oysters, abalone, and salmon for the Christmas dinner table.

title.children: Marine heatwave looming this summer, with potential to impact some much-loved Aussie seafood

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman on-stage speaking. She is a wheelchair user

items.synopsis: There are fears in the Australian community that disability is "infecting" and interfering with the lives of non-disabled people, a disability royal commissioner has told its closing ceremony in Sydney.

title.children: Some Australians fear disability is 'infecting' lives of non-disabled people, royal commissioner says

image.altText: two men dressed in hazmat protective clothing walk with fire personnel outside a building

items.synopsis: Authorities say 30 people were evacuated from the swimming facility in Prestons near Liverpool just after 4pm, after reports that a number of people were feeling unwell.

title.children: 'Toxic cloud': Six children, four adults in hospital after exposure to chemicals at Sydney swim centre

image.altText: A Carlton AFL shouts with joy as his teammate lifts him up in celebration after a goal.

items.synopsis: Carlton is through to the preliminary final for the first time in nearly a quarter of a century, after a win over Melbourne in their semifinal.

title.children: Acres goal in dying seconds delivers Blues victory over Demons in heartstopping semifinal

image.altText: A man reaches out to score in a rugby league match

items.synopsis: Cameron Munster and Will Warbrick combine in the final minutes of the match to deliver Melbourne an incredible finals win over the Roosters.

title.children: Spectacular aerial try in 79th minute keeps Storm's season alive in remarkable finals finish against Roosters

image.altText: MInister Linda Burney during Question Time in a bright pink coat.

items.synopsis: The Indigenous Australians minister says she feels betrayed by Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's comment that First Nations people are not being affected by colonialism because "we now have running water".

title.children: Linda Burney says she was 'shocked' by Nampijinpa Price's comments on Voice debate

image.altText: Ariarne smiles softly in a selfie of her lying in bed in her silk stripped pajamas.

items.synopsis: The freestyle world record holder said she was "petrified" the discovery in her ovary could impact her "biggest dream" and chances of becoming a mother.

title.children: 'Scary time for me': Olympian Ariarne Titmus undergoes surgery to remove benign tumours

image.altText: Luis Rubiales walks past a grey background with a serious expression

items.synopsis: Luis Rubiales, the former head of Spain's soccer federation, faces accusations of sexual assault and coercion after kissing a Women's World Cup player.

title.children: Disgraced Spanish soccer head given restraining order in World Cup case

image.altText: Close up of man in suit

items.synopsis: The Russian Security Council secretary's claim comes amid a Russian man being sentenced to 12-and-a-half years jail for sending missile components to the US.

title.children: Putin ally claims Russia has 'neutralised' hundreds of foreign spies

image.altText: A coat of arms and sign saying 'Local Court' on a column outside a courthouse.

items.synopsis: A former Don Dale detainee who was recently awarded damages from the Northern Territory government has appeared in court facing "very serious allegations".

title.children: Former Don Dale inmate arrested week after winning $220K in damages

image.altText: iPhone 12 Pro and iPhone 12 Pro Max feature a new, elevated flat-edge stainless steel design

items.synopsis: Apple has continued to contest the French radiation findings, as Belgium says it will still conduct its own review into the model.

title.children: Apple issues iPhone 12 update to end France radiation row

image.altText: The icon for the video sharing TikTok app is seen on a smartphone.

items.synopsis: The Chinese owned social media app was forced to pay around $570 million in fines for violating child privacy through features such as default public profiles.

title.children: TikTok failed to protect child privacy, claims EU tech watchdog

image.altText: Entrance to Dymocks bookstore in Hay Street, Perth

items.synopsis: Dymocks has confirmed that the contact details of over one million customers were obtained and shared on the dark web during last week's data breach.

title.children: Dymocks confirms details of 1.2 million customers shared on dark web

items.synopsis: How sneaker brands charge up to 10,000 times the cost of manufacturing — and fans eat it up.

title.children: How sneaker companies get away with marking shoes up 10,000 times the cost of manufacturing

image.altText: Man lying down in stretcher near ambulances.

items.synopsis: The Department of Defence faces a single charge of breaching federal workplace health and safety laws, which carries a maximum penalty of a $1.5 million fine.

title.children: Defence faces court after soldiers mauled in Far North Queensland croc attack

image.altText: an illustration if chris dawson while he sits inside a courtroom

items.synopsis: The judge said the former Sydney school teacher used a degree of manipulation and exploitation to breach the girl's trust in the 1980s.

title.children: Chris Dawson jailed for unlawful sexual activity with schoolgirl

image.altText: A cabinet neatly showcases a variety of blue and orange mugs, bowls, plates, glassware and vases.

items.synopsis: It's one of those small things that causes big arguments in a household — should cups, mugs and glasses be stored rim up or rim down?

title.children: Rim up or down: Does it matter how you store your glasses and cups?
